page.title: 17A FARM VISIT TO G. VALLEY II
page.content: they milked by hand,made butter for the Fishguard market and sent the milk away in Metal Churns.Today the milk is collected in a bulk milk tank which is kept cool and stored until a large milk tanker arrives on its daily visit to empty the tank and deliver it to the bottling plant some miles away.It was clear from our visit that farming in the Gwaun Valley had not developed as much as it was capable of.Machinery was generally basic but it did make much easier than it had been in the past.
